alert.note: Alert for Albany; Carbon (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 24 at 11:17AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR MULLEN BURN SCAR UNTIL 215 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Wyoming and southeast Wyoming, including the following counties, in south central Wyoming, Carbon. In southeast Wyoming, Albany. * WHEN...Until 215 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1115 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.2 and 0.3 inches of rain have fallen. - Mullen burn scar is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Albany, Illinois Creek Campground, Bobbie Thompson Campground, Miller Lake Campground, Evans Creek Campground, Six Mile Campground and Woods Landing-Jelm. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move away from recently burned areas. Flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains may trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
